footer.slogan: Please respect local laws and etiquette during your pilgrimage.

embed.missingDataId: Route data missing data-id (please update and republish).
embed.dataNotFound: Route data not found (please update and republish).

routeCard.onlyFirstRouteNote: Showing only the first route (main route) from each article by default.

errors.gifTooLarge: GIF is too large ({size}), please compress before uploading
errors.imageTooLarge: Image is too large ({size}), still exceeds {maxSize} after compression
errors.imageTooLargeSimple: Image is too large, please keep it under {maxSize}
errors.uploadFailedMultiple: {count} images failed to upload, {success} others inserted.
errors.invalidLinkFormat: Invalid link format (only http/https/mailto or relative paths allowed).

seichiRoute.hint: Note: Saving will update the article content.

home.heroSubtitle: With readable long-form articles, exquisite layouts, and practical location lists,
home.heroSubtitleLine2: we help you plan every pilgrimage from screen to reality.
home.appPromoDescriptionLine2: Carry the magic of anime in your pocket, ready to depart anytime.

about.heroSubtitleLine2: And pilgrimage is touching the edge of that dream in reality.
about.missionCard1Description: We reject vague "approximate locations." We pursue precise coordinates down to latitude and longitude, comparing anime frames with real-world scenes, missing no detail.
about.missionCard2Description: Guides shouldn't be dry instruction manuals. We insist on refined image-text layouts, making the reading experience itself a beautiful spiritual pilgrimage.
about.missionCard3Description: From transportation plans to optimal shooting positions, we provide step-by-step operational guidance, solving the "how to get there" challenge so your departure is never hesitant.
about.whyParagraph1: Often, when we finish a moving anime and feel the urge to "visit this place," we stop at the tedious information search. Scattered coordinates, blurry screenshots, outdated transit info... these obstacles gradually cool our passion.
about.whyParagraph2: We want to change that. SeichiGo is dedicated to organizing the clearest, most beautiful, and most practical pilgrimage guides. We hope that when you stand at that intersection, you won't need to fumble between apps and web pages, but can look up calmly and say to that scenery:
about.futureDescription: We're developing a mobile app with plans to support offline maps, one-tap navigation, and pilgrimage check-ins.
about.futureDescriptionLine2: Our goal is to put all pilgrimage sites in your pocket, becoming your most reliable companion in breaking the dimensional wall.
about.contactDescription: Whether you've found data errors, want to submit your pilgrimage story, or have business collaboration inquiries, we look forward to hearing from you.

bookShelf.emptyState: No articles yet, fill the bookshelf with your submissions.
